question_text: Which film features the quote, 'Here's looking at you, kid'?
learning_capsule: Humphrey Bogart delivered this iconic line in Casablanca.

question_text: In what year was 'Gone with the Wind' released?
learning_capsule: It’s one of the earliest blockbuster films.

question_text: Who directed 'Psycho'?
learning_capsule: Hitchcock was known as the master of suspense.

question_text: Which silent film star was known as 'The Tramp'?
learning_capsule: Chaplin’s character is iconic.

question_text: What 1941 film is often cited as the greatest of all time?
learning_capsule: Orson Welles wrote, directed, and starred.

question_text: Which musical won Best Picture in 1961?
learning_capsule: A modern Romeo & Juliet adaptation.

question_text: Who played Scarlett O’Hara in 'Gone with the Wind'?
learning_capsule: She won an Oscar for her performance.

question_text: Which actor said 'You can't handle the truth!'?
learning_capsule: The quote is from 'A Few Good Men'.

question_text: What was the first color feature film?
learning_capsule: 'Becky Sharp' (1935) was first in full color.

question_text: Which 1952 musical includes 'Singin’ in the Rain'?
learning_capsule: Gene Kelly danced in the rain.

learning_capsule: A multiverse film dominated awards.

learning_capsule: James Cameron returned for the sequel.

learning_capsule: Pattinson gave a darker tone to the role.

learning_capsule: He played a reclusive English teacher.

question_text: Who directed the 2023 film 'Killers of the Flower Moon'?
learning_capsule: Scorsese adapts a true crime story.

question_text: Which animated film won Best Animated Feature at the 2023 Oscars?

learning_capsule: A cult hit known for callbacks.

learning_capsule: Netflix’s supernatural hit.

question_text: What show stars Zendaya as Rue?

question_text: Which show is a prequel to Breaking Bad?

learning_capsule: The first woman to play the Doctor.

question_text: Which comedy features Ted Lasso coaching soccer?
learning_capsule: An American football coach takes on the Premier League.

question_text: Which musical features the song 'Defying Gravity'?
learning_capsule: Elphaba and Glinda sing this powerful duet.

question_text: Who wrote the musical 'Hamilton'?
learning_capsule: Miranda also played the title role.

question_text: Which musical takes place during the French Revolution?
learning_capsule: Jean Valjean is its central character.

question_text: Which musical is set in New York's East Village and follows struggling artists?
learning_capsule: It’s based on the opera La Bohème.

learning_capsule: It opens the second act.

question_text: What is the name of the princess in Disney’s 'The Little Mermaid'?

learning_capsule: It’s about friendship between a boy and a dragon.

learning_capsule: A visually stunning multiverse sequel.

question_text: Who composed the 'Fifth Symphony'?
learning_capsule: Beethoven’s 'da-da-da-DUM' motif is iconic.

question_text: Who wrote 'The Magic Flute'?
learning_capsule: One of Mozart’s most famous operas.

learning_capsule: He continued to compose despite hearing loss.

learning_capsule: Bach’s work influenced generations.

question_text: Who composed 'The Four Seasons'?
learning_capsule: Each concerto represents a season.

learning_capsule: A soft and atmospheric piano piece.

learning_capsule: Famous for its use of cannons.

learning_capsule: He composed from early childhood.

learning_capsule: It’s part of his 'Ring Cycle'.

learning_capsule: A single long crescendo piece.

question_text: Who is the 'King of Rock and Roll'?
learning_capsule: His hip moves and voice made history.

learning_capsule: A psychedelic rock legend.

learning_capsule: A grunge icon.

learning_capsule: The Who’s guitarist was destructive.

learning_capsule: Led by Bono, U2 formed in Dublin.

learning_capsule: A lead single from the album 'Midnights'.

learning_capsule: She won it at age 18.

learning_capsule: His stage name drops the third 'e'.

learning_capsule: The Eras Tour became a global event.

learning_capsule: A synth-pop hit from his album 'Harry's House'.

learning_capsule: Known for her vocal range and scat singing.

question_text: Which trumpeter is famous for 'What a Wonderful World'?
learning_capsule: His gravelly voice is iconic.

question_text: Which genre combines jazz and rock?
learning_capsule: Jazz fusion emerged in the late 1960s.

question_text: Which jazz musician released 'Kind of Blue'?
learning_capsule: One of the most influential jazz albums.

question_text: Who is known for 'Georgia on My Mind'?
learning_capsule: Blended blues, gospel, and R&B.

question_text: What instrument did John Coltrane primarily play?
learning_capsule: He transformed modern jazz.

question_text: Which style of jazz emphasizes fast tempos and improvisation?
learning_capsule: Developed in the 1940s.

question_text: Which blues musician was nicknamed 'King of the Blues'?
learning_capsule: Played a guitar named Lucille.

question_text: Which female singer is known for 'Strange Fruit'?
learning_capsule: A protest song against racism.

question_text: Which pianist composed 'Take Five'?
learning_capsule: Known for its unusual 5/4 time signature.

question_text: How many notes are in a standard musical octave?
learning_capsule: 12 semitones make up a chromatic scale.

question_text: Which clef is used for higher-pitched instruments?
learning_capsule: Also called the G clef.

question_text: Which term means 'slow tempo'?
learning_capsule: A slow and graceful speed.

question_text: Which key has no sharps or flats?
learning_capsule: C major is the simplest key.

question_text: Which symbol raises a note by a half step?
learning_capsule: The '#' sign indicates a sharp.

question_text: How many beats does a whole note get in 4/4 time?
learning_capsule: It takes a full measure.

question_text: Which dynamic marking means 'very loud'?
learning_capsule: Fortissimo is double loud.

question_text: Which scale includes all 12 notes?
learning_capsule: The chromatic scale has no key center.

question_text: What is a group of 3 notes played in the time of 2 called?
learning_capsule: Triplets divide a beat into three.

question_text: Which time signature is known as 'common time'?
learning_capsule: The most standard time signature.
